verses.verse: “The (Job 28:28; Ps. 111:10; Prov. 1:7) fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, And the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
(Prov. 3:2, 16) For by me your days will be multiplied, And years of life will be added to you.
(Job 35:6, 7; Prov. 16:26) If you are wise, you are wise for yourself, And if you scoff, you will bear it alone.”
The Way of Folly (Prov. 7:11) A foolish woman is clamorous; She is simple, and knows nothing.
For she sits at the door of her house, On a seat (Prov. 9:3) by the highest places of the city,
To call to those who pass by, Who go straight on their way:
“Whoever (Prov. 7:7, 8) is simple, let him turn in here”; And as for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,
“Stolen (Prov. 20:17) water is sweet, And bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
But he does not know that (Prov. 2:18; 7:27) the dead are there, That her guests are in the depths of hell.
Wise Sayings of Solomon The proverbs of (Prov. 1:1; 25:1) Solomon: (Prov. 15:20; 17:21, 25; 19:13; 29:3, 15) A wise son makes a glad father, But a foolish son is the grief of his mother.
(Ps. 49:7; Prov. 11:4; 21:6; Ezek. 7:19; (Luke 12:19, 20)) Treasures of wickedness profit nothing, (Dan. 4:27) But righteousness delivers from death.
(Ps. 34:9, 10; 37:25; Prov. 28:25; (Matt. 6:33)) The LORD will not allow the righteous soul to famish, But He casts away the desire of the wicked.
(Prov. 19:15) He who has a slack hand becomes poor, But (Prov. 12:24; 13:4; 21:5) the hand of the diligent makes rich.
He who gathers in (Prov. 6:8) summer is a wise son; He who sleeps in harvest is (Prov. 19:26) a son who causes shame.
Blessings are on the head of the righteous, But violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
(Ps. 112:6; Eccl. 8:10) The memory of the righteous is blessed, But the name of the wicked will rot.
The wise in heart will receive commands, (Prov. 10:10) But a prating fool will fall.
((Ps. 23:4; Prov. 3:23; 28:18; Is. 33:15, 16)) He who walks with integrity walks securely, But he who perverts his ways will become known.
He who winks with the eye causes trouble, But a prating fool will fall.
The mouth of the righteous is a well of life, But violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
Hatred stirs up strife, But (Prov. 17:9; (1 Cor. 13:4-7; James 5:20); 1 Pet. 4:8) love covers all sins.
Wisdom is found on the lips of him who has understanding, But (Prov. 26:3) a rod is for the back of him who is devoid of understanding.
Wise people store up knowledge, But (Prov. 18:7) the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
The (Job 31:24; Ps. 52:7; Prov. 18:11; (1 Tim. 6:17)) rich man’s wealth is his strong city; The destruction of the poor is their poverty.
The labor of the righteous leads to (Prov. 6:23) life, The wages of the wicked to sin.
He who keeps instruction is in the way of life, But he who refuses correction goes astray.
Whoever (Prov. 26:24) hides hatred has lying lips, And (Ps. 15:3; 101:5) whoever spreads slander is a fool.
(Job 11:2; (Prov. 18:21); Eccl. 5:3) In the multitude of words sin is not lacking, But (Prov. 17:27; (James 1:19; 3:2)) he who restrains his lips is wise.
The tongue of the righteous is choice silver; The heart of the wicked is worth little.
The lips of the righteous feed many, But fools die for lack of wisdom.
(Gen. 24:35; 26:12; Deut. 8:18; Ps. 37:22; Prov. 8:21) The blessing of the LORD makes one rich, And He adds no sorrow with it.
(Prov. 2:14; 15:21) To do evil is like sport to a fool, But a man of understanding has wisdom.
